content.raw: Nice catch. Not sure why we’re not using std::unique\_ptr in the first place.
content.html: Nice catch. Not sure why we’re not using std::unique_ptr in the first place.

content.raw: I think it’s related to that. The only reason I noticed was because I hadn’t updated my SDF yet and my linter was complaining that the constructor was deleted.
content.html: I think it’s related to that. The only reason I noticed was because I hadn’t updated my SDF yet and my linter was complaining that the constructor was deleted.

update.title: Add Material component

content.raw: I can't reproduce it anymore, maybe it was before I had made the SDF changes. Thanks for pointing this out, going to change geometry too.
content.html: I can't reproduce it anymore, maybe it was before I had made the SDF changes. Thanks for pointing this out, going to change geometry too.
Same as this: we can do components::Geometry(*collision->Geom());

content.raw: I was getting a segfault doing that, so I started explicitly calling the ~~default~~ copy constructor. Let me try to get a backtrace to show you.
content.html: I was getting a segfault doing that, so I started explicitly calling the default copy constructor. Let me try to get a backtrace to show you.

content.raw: I believe `*visual->Material()` is already of type `sdf::Material`. We should be able to just do `components::Material(*visual->Material())`
content.html: I believe *visual->Material() is already of type sdf::Material. We should be able to just do components::Material(*visual->Material())
